job_title: Marketing in Dundee, Scotland
pros: great team for collaboration young
cons: sometimes stressful with students and some paper work

job_title: Werkstudent in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Nice colleagues Good work equipment
cons: Not allowed to work anywhere when working as a Working student here Very slow decision processes

job_title: Project Manager in Frankfurt am Main
pros: German employment contract and good social benefits. Interesting place to work and an international environment. Very good work/life balance.
cons: High taxation and social deductions on gross salary, little room for growth in the organisation.

job_title: Project Assistant in Frankfurt am Main
pros: International environment, amazing colleagues, opportunity to learn about development finance if one is involved in the implementation of projects as experts
cons: Zero room to grow, they will keep you as project assistant for good if you do not have good relationship with your manager. Managers are there since 15 years. The work can also be extremely boring where they will only make you to look for experts and fake their CVs to apply for tenders announced by IFIs. Very little room to grow. The pay is also extremely low

job_title: Project Coordinator in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Nice people, nice office, interesting thematic.
cons: Very operational work, lack of information about bonus, promotions, sometimes you can have a master degree but do a really operational and boring work.

job_title: Project Coordinator in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Steep learning curve, nice environment
cons: No benefits, low salary, no proper internal processes

job_title: Professor in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Great research environment and nice colleagues
cons: Management should care more about the employees

job_title: Project Manager in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Flexibility on where to work.
cons: Nothing to say as a con.

review_title: Excellent PhD Program with good funding
job_title: PhD Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Focus on research, very good guidance, excellent research environment with guest speakers from the US and other leading universities in Europe
cons: There are no downsides. I think it is a great position to get started for an academic career.

review_title: Ok for a couple of years
job_title: Recruitment Officer in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
- Good work-life-balance
- Compensation for overtime (extra days/hours off)
- Depending on department, young and fun team
cons:
- Huge lack of communication
- Favoritism
- Pay
- Things are not kept confidential. Managers won't keep anything private and enjoy gossiping
- Not many opportunities to grow, especially if not one of the favorites

review_title: A good place to work but not much room for growth
job_title: Student Recruitment Manager in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
- Great team
- Ownership of projects
- A creative role
- Contact with many different people through nature of role
- Travel opportunities 
- Time sheet / Zeiterfassung
- Workers council/ Betreibsrat
cons:
- Minimal bonuses
- Lack of space for growth 
- Little time put into your development

job_title: Digitalisation Project Leader in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Innovative projects, Good supervisor and great team
cons: Culture and integrity within the company.

pros:
- Encouraging Team 
- Nice work environment
- Flexible time schedule
- Easy tasks
cons: - Non-diversified tasks, which can get boring as time passes by

job_title: PhD Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Equipments and campus are good
cons: Support and training are limited

job_title: Program Coordinator in Frankfurt am Main

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Frankfurt am Main

job_title: Business Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros:
Good faculties, though some are average.

It may prepare you for impact with the German (product-based) culture/job market.

Very good and promising location: Frankfurt.
cons:
Total lack of service culture towards students. The focus appears to not be the learning and development but in the processing a "packet" from the enrollment to the graduation. 

There is a strong "anti-"customer influence from the German culture, perhaps for the fact that most of the employees are German.

Bitterly disappointed from the time they made me waste for unimportant things (or perhaps important only to them!).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Frankfurt am Main
pros: A fast growing, successful, innovative institution that has a lot of opportunities for motivated people. I've not been here long but I have seen many young people given opportunities and promotions and fresh ideas are rewarded.
cons: There are still too many people who are unwilling to change and modernise and are stuck in their inflexible old ways of thinking

review_title: Dont work for this company! Dont waste your time!
job_title: Project Coordinator in Frankfurt am Main
pros: The campus is very great (of course only for students who can enjoy it)
cons:
I am working for 1,5 years here and have seen within the first 3 months how everything works here. 

You start with Project Assistant and will get paid 1.600 EUR Netto. Then, if they promote you you will be a "Project Coordinator" and have literally only EUR 200 Netto more on your account.  After 4 Years of wasting your time in this company you can be a "project manager" where you will have around 600 EUR more. This is information from colleagues working there. 

There is a high fluctuation of employees at the Frankfurt School because smart people realize very quickly that there is no way achieve something at this company. They dont support your further education, nor do they care about your personal feedback. I complaint so many times about my supervisor because of his bad management style but no one cared what i was feeling. The people at the "top" sit there for 20+ years and they all support each other and dont care about their employees. 

The job you are doing at this company are heavy administrative things: Writing invoices, writing invitation letters to foreign participants, booking hotels and company visits for foreign participants, dealing literally with every problem these people have during their stay in Frankfurt, booking seminar rooms and so on. Basically this is a secretary job, no matter whether you have an MBA or not. There is nothing you learn from this company and there is no way you can grow personally. This is a waste of time and i WARN you, dont work for this company. 

 The call themselves "sustainable academy" but what goes inside with regard to their employees is not sustainable at all, everything is a lie !

I hope people read this before they think of working there

review_title: Working Student - International Advisory Services, Frankfurt School
job_title: Working Student in Frankfurt am Main
pros: Friendly people. Great work culture and oppertunity to learn a lot and get involved in various activities.
cons: Nothing in my case. It was made clear of the tasks from day one, and a couple of months down the lane I was trusted with more serious tasks and oppertunity to learn new things.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Frankfurt (Oder)
pros: International environment, great learning environment
cons: Low paid jobs, no clear training plan for new employees
